title: Understanding the Context System
text: chat AI assistant like Cassidy, AI doesn‚Äôt access computer, files, R session. knows tell conversation.¬†Context¬†background information provide help AI understand project give relevant, accurate responses. Think like calling colleague help. just say ‚Äúisn‚Äôt code working?‚Äù, can‚Äôt help much. say ‚Äú‚Äôm building R package survey analysis, using tidyverse style, function throwing error pass tibble instead data frame‚Äù ‚Äî now context give useful advice. cassidyr package provides tools automatically gather send context Cassidy, don‚Äôt manually copy-paste code, describe data, explain project setup every time.

title: Understanding the Context System
text: cassidyr‚Äôs context system four main components: Component | Function | Captures | |‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì|‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-|‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî| |¬†Project¬†|¬†cassidy_context_project()¬†| CASSIDY.md config, Git status, R session info | |¬†Data¬†|¬†cassidy_context_data()¬†| Data frames environment | |¬†Files¬†|¬†cassidy_describe_file()¬†| Contents specific code files | |¬†Environment¬†|¬†cassidy_context_env()¬†| Objects loaded R, packages | component can used independently combined together comprehensive context.

title: Understanding the Context System
text: Project context provides AI understanding overall project structure, preferences, configuration. important piece project context ¬†CASSIDY.md¬†file. markdown file document: project coding preferences style Key files purposes Common tasks need help Create one : üìã use specialized template: üìã file automatically read start¬†cassidy_app()¬†gather project context. can place configuration several locations: Location | File | Use Case | |‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-|‚Äî‚Äî|‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-| | Project root |¬†CASSIDY.md¬†| Shared team via Git | | Hidden directory |¬†.cassidy/CASSIDY.md¬†| Keeps root directory clean | | Local |¬†CASSIDY.local.md¬†| Personal preferences (gitignored) | | User-level |¬†~/.cassidy/CASSIDY.md¬†| Applies projects | cassidyr searches recursively working directory (inspired Claude Code), reading files order lowest highest priority. specific (project-level) settings override broader (user-level) defaults. enables organization-wide standards parent directories combined project-specific configurations. üìã context levels control much information gathered: minimal: R version, IDE, CASSIDY.md (~1-2 KB) standard: Adds file structure, Git status, environment objects (~3-5 KB) comprehensive: Adds commit history, function extraction, detailed object info (~5-15 KB)
code: use_cassidy_md() use_cassidy_md(template = "package")    # R package development use_cassidy_md(template = "analysis")   # Data analysis project use_cassidy_md(template = "survey")     # Survey research # Standard context (recommended for most uses) ctx <- cassidy_context_project()  # Minimal - just R session and config ctx_min <- cassidy_context_project(level = "minimal")  # Comprehensive - includes Git history, full file listing ctx_full <- cassidy_context_project(level = "comprehensive")

title: Understanding the Context System
text: working data analysis, AI needs understand datasets. cassidyr provides several ways describe data frames. üìã control, use¬†cassidy_describe_df(): üìã three methods serve different purposes: Method | Best | Includes | |‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì|‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-|‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-| |¬†codebook¬†| Survey data labels | Variable labels, value labels, factor levels | |¬†skim¬†| Exploratory analysis | Distribution stats, histograms, missing patterns | |¬†basic¬†| Quick overview | Types, ranges, missing counts | sending data context, might want check problems: üìã
code: # See what data frames are in your environment cassidy_context_data()  # Get detailed summaries cassidy_context_data(detailed = TRUE) # Using the codebook method (best for labelled survey data) desc <- cassidy_describe_df(my_survey_data, method = "codebook")  # Using skimr for statistical summaries desc <- cassidy_describe_df(my_data, method = "skim")  # Basic method (no extra dependencies) desc <- cassidy_describe_df(mtcars, method = "basic") issues <- cassidy_detect_issues(my_data) print(issues) # Shows: high missing data, constant columns, outliers, duplicates

title: Understanding the Context System
text: Often need AI see specific code files help debugging, refactoring, documentation. üìã working many files, can control much content sent: üìã summary index levels include ¬†[REQUEST_FILE:path]¬†marker tells AI can request full file needed. bird‚Äôs-eye view project‚Äôs files: üìã
code: # Read an entire file ctx <- cassidy_describe_file("R/my-function.R")  # Read specific lines (great for focusing on one function) ctx <- cassidy_describe_file("R/analysis.R", lines = 45:120)  # Read a range ctx <- cassidy_describe_file("R/analysis.R", line_range = c(100, 200))  # Without line numbers (cleaner for short snippets) ctx <- cassidy_describe_file("R/utils.R", show_line_numbers = FALSE) # Full content (default) ctx <- cassidy_describe_file("R/big-file.R", level = "full")  # Summary - first/last 10 lines with line numbers ctx <- cassidy_describe_file("R/big-file.R", level = "summary")  # Index - just metadata and function names ctx <- cassidy_describe_file("R/big-file.R", level = "index") # Quick overview cassidy_file_summary()  # With file sizes and line counts cassidy_file_summary(level = "standard")  # With function extraction from R files cassidy_file_summary(level = "comprehensive")

text: easiest way use cassidyr interactive chat application: opens Shiny-based chat interface can: Chat Cassidy AI assistant Automatically share project context Add files conversation Switch multiple conversations Export chat history Markdown Cassidyr automatically saves conversations: chat interface, dynamically add files give AI context: Click Context panel toggle (left sidebar) Expand Files section Browse select files project Click Apply Context send updated context AI access selected files‚Äô contents.
code: library(cassidyr)  # Launch the chat interface cassidy_app() # Resume your most recent conversation (default) cassidy_app()  # Start fresh with new context cassidy_app(new_chat = TRUE)  # List saved conversations cassidy_list_conversations()  # Export a conversation to Markdown cassidy_export_conversation("conv_20240115_123456")  # Delete old conversations cassidy_delete_conversation("conv_20240101_000000")

what: How cassidyr Looks Up Memory Files
title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: cassidyr searches memory files recursively directory tree (following Claude Code‚Äôs approach), enabling organization-wide configurations parent directories combined project-specific settings. use cassidy_context_project() cassidy_app(), cassidyr automatically: Searches upward current working directory filesystem root Loads user-level memory first: ~/.cassidy/CASSIDY.md ~/.cassidy/rules/*.md CASSIDY.md .cassidy/CASSIDY.md CASSIDY.local.md (gitignored, personal notes) .cassidy/rules/*.md (modular rules) Applies precedence: specific (project-level) instructions override broader (user-level) ones recursive search particularly useful monorepos working nested directories within larger project structure. Anyone clones R package see exactly context used. multiple memory files found, cassidyr applies order specific instructions taking precedence: User-level memory (~/.cassidy/) - Lowest priority (applies projects) Ancestor directory memory - Medium priority (applies project families) Current directory memory - Highest priority (applies specific project) Within level, CASSIDY.local.md priority CASSIDY.md, allowing personal preferences coexist team settings without conflicts. calling cassidy_read_context_file() directly, default non-recursive (searches current directory). Enable recursive search :
code: cassidy_read_context_file(recursive = TRUE)

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: easiest way create project memory file use_cassidy_md() function: cassidyr provides several templates get started: can also manually create CASSIDY.md file. basic example:
code: library(cassidyr)  # Create CASSIDY.md in project root use_cassidy_md()  # Create in .cassidy/ directory (keeps root clean) use_cassidy_md(location = "hidden")  # Create local-only file (not shared with team) use_cassidy_md(location = "local") # Default template - general purpose use_cassidy_md(template = "default")  # Package development template use_cassidy_md(template = "package")  # Data analysis template use_cassidy_md(template = "analysis")  # Survey research template use_cassidy_md(template = "survey") # Project Context for Cassidy AI  ## Project Overview This is an R package for analyzing survey data with a focus on factor analysis and scale reliability.  ## Key Files - `R/factor_analysis.R` - Main EFA/CFA functions - `R/reliability.R` - Cronbach's alpha and omega calculations - `data/survey_data.rda` - Example dataset  ## Coding Preferences - Style: tidyverse with native pipe `|>` - Prefer `dplyr` over base R for data manipulation - Use `ggplot2` for all visualizations - Maximum line length: 80 characters - Always include roxygen2 documentation  ## Common Tasks - Running factor analyses and interpreting results - Creating publication-quality tables - Writing methods sections in APA format - Generating codebooks  ## Packages to Use - `psych` for factor analysis - `lavaan` for CFA - `gt` for tables - `ggplot2` for visualization

code: # R Coding Style Guidelines  ## Function Naming - Use `snake_case` for all function names - Prefix exported functions with package name (e.g., `mypackage_analyze()`) - Use `.` prefix for internal helpers  ## Documentation - All exported functions must have complete roxygen2 documentation - Include `@examples` with realistic use cases - Use markdown formatting (`@md` in DESCRIPTION)  ## Testing - Use `testthat 3e` for all tests - Test names should follow: `test_that("function does X when Y")` - Aim for >80% code coverage # Data Visualization Preferences  ## ggplot2 Standards - Always use `theme_minimal()` as base - Use viridis color scales for continuous variables - Include informative titles and axis labels - Save plots at 300 DPI for publications  ## Default Settings - Figure width: 8 inches - Figure height: 6 inches - Font size: 12pt for body, 14pt for titles

",     file = ".cassidy/rules/testing.md" ) # Set up analysis memory use_cassidy_md(template = "analysis")  # Add your data context cat(" ## Current Dataset  - **Name**: Customer Survey 2024 - **N**: 1,247 respondents - **Key Variables**:   - satisfaction (1-7 Likert)   - nps (0-10 scale)   - demographic variables - **Missing Data**: ~5% on satisfaction items.  ## Analysis Plan  1. ",     file = "CASSIDY.md",     append = TRUE ) # Set up survey memory use_cassidy_md(template = "survey")  # Add scale information cat(" ## Measurement Scales  ### Job Satisfaction (5 items, Œ± = .89) - Items: JS1-JS5. - Response scale: 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 7 (Strongly Agree). - Reverse coded: JS2, JS4.  ### Organizational Commitment (6 items, Œ± = .92) - Items: OC1-OC6. - Response scale: 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 7 (Strongly Agree). - No reverse coding.  ## Analysis Notes - Use lavaan for CFA. - Report œâ alongside Œ±. - Include fit indices: CFI, TLI, RMSEA, SRMR. ",     file = "CASSIDY.md",     append = TRUE )

title: Managing Project Memory in cassidyr
text: Inspired Claude Code: cassidyr adapts Claude Code‚Äôs memory system R Recursive default: Searches directory tree normal usage (cassidy_context_project(), cassidy_app()) Hierarchical precedence: User-level ‚Üí ancestor directories ‚Üí current directory (specific wins) Use CASSIDY.md team-shared project context Use CASSIDY.local.md personal project settings (auto-gitignored) Use .cassidy/rules/ modular, organized guidelines Files automatically loaded start cassidy_app() specific, use structure, review periodically information context gathering chat functionality, see: vignette("context-system") ‚Äî Understanding context system. ?cassidy_app ‚Äî Chat application documentation. ?use_cassidy_md ‚Äî Creating memory files.

code: library(cassidyr)  # Launch the chat app cassidy_app()

title: Connect to CassidyAI API
text: scripting automation:
code: library(cassidyr)  # Simple one-off chat result <- cassidy_chat("How do I create a bar plot in ggplot2?") print(result$response)  # Continue the conversation result <- cassidy_chat(   "Can you show me an example with the mtcars dataset?",   thread_id = result$thread_id )  # Or use session-based chat for interactive use session <- cassidy_session() chat(session, "What is the tidyverse?") chat(session, "Which package should I use for data cleaning?")

title: Connect to CassidyAI API
text: control thread management:
code: # Create a thread thread_id <- cassidy_create_thread()  # Send messages response <- cassidy_send_message(thread_id, "What is the tidyverse?") print(response)  # Retrieve conversation history thread <- cassidy_get_thread(thread_id)  # List all threads threads <- cassidy_list_threads()

title: Connect to CassidyAI API
text: Provide rich context improve AI responses. cassidyr‚Äôs memory system (inspired Claude Code) searches recursively directory tree, combining user-level preferences project-specific settings: Memory files can placed multiple levels: - User-level: ~/.cassidy/CASSIDY.md (applies projects) - Project-level: CASSIDY.md .cassidy/CASSIDY.md (shared team) - Local: CASSIDY.local.md (personal, auto-gitignored) - Modular: .cassidy/rules/*.md (organized topic)
code: # Create a CASSIDY.md file for your project use_cassidy_md()  # Creates CASSIDY.md with project instructions  # Gather comprehensive project context (includes CASSIDY.md files) ctx <- cassidy_context_project(level = "standard")  # Describe a data frame for the AI cassidy_describe_df(mtcars)  # Files are automatically loaded when you start cassidy_app()

title: Connect to CassidyAI API

title: Connect to CassidyAI API
code: # Simple agentic task (safe mode enabled by default) result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "List all R files in this directory and describe what they do" )  # Task with specific tools result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "Search for TODO comments in my code",   tools = c("list_files", "search_files", "read_file"),   max_iterations = 5 )  # Disable safe mode (use with caution!) result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "Create a helper function in R/helpers.R",   safe_mode = FALSE )

title: Connect to CassidyAI API

what: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
text: Execute task AI assistant autonomously uses tools accomplish complex goals. Uses hybrid architecture: Assistant reasoning, Workflow structured tool decisions, R execution.

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
code: cassidy_agentic_task(   task,   assistant_id = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID"),   api_key = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_API_KEY"),   tools = names(.cassidy_tools),   working_dir = getwd(),   max_iterations = 10,   initial_context = NULL,   safe_mode = TRUE,   approval_callback = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
text: task Character. task description assistant_id Character. CassidyAI assistant ID (default: env var) api_key Character. CassidyAI API key (default: env var) tools Character vector. Tools enable (default: ) working_dir Character. Working directory (default: current) max_iterations Integer. Max tool calls (default: 10). Use Inf unlimited. initial_context Character/list. Optional context provide safe_mode Logical. Require approval risky tools? (default: TRUE) approval_callback Function. Custom approval handler (default: NULL) verbose Logical. Show progress? (default: TRUE)

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
text: cassidy_agentic_result object containing: task original task description final_response Final response completion message iterations Number iterations completed actions_taken List actions performed thread_id CassidyAI thread ID success Whether task completed successfully

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
text: Safe Mode enabled default, requiring user approval risky operations like writing files executing code. protects unintended changes system.

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
text: agentic system uses direct parsing: Assistant analyzes task chooses tool structured format R parsing extracts tool decision response R functions execute tools proper error handling Results sent back assistant next steps assistant responds structured <TOOL_DECISION> blocks specify tool use parameters provide.

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
text: safe_mode = TRUE (default), risky operations require approval: write_file: Writing/modifying files execute_code: Executing R code prompted approve, deny, edit parameters, view details risky action. Safe mode can disabled setting safe_mode = FALSE, use caution!

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
text: Provide approval logic callback function:
code: my_approver <- function(action, input, reasoning) {   # Auto-approve read operations, deny writes   list(approved = action == "read_file", input = input) }  cassidy_agentic_task("Analyze code", approval_callback = my_approver)

title: Run an Agentic Task with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_agentic_task
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Simple task with safe mode (default) result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "List all R files and describe what they do" )  # Task with limited tools (read-only) result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "Analyze the package structure",   tools = c("list_files", "read_file", "get_context"),   max_iterations = 5 )  # Unlimited iterations for complex tasks result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "Refactor all test files to use modern patterns",   max_iterations = Inf )  # Allow risky operations without approval (use with caution!) result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "Create a helper function in R/helpers.R",   safe_mode = FALSE )  # Provide initial context ctx <- cassidy_context_project(level = "standard") result <- cassidy_agentic_task(   "Review my code and suggest improvements",   initial_context = ctx$text ) } # }

what: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
text: Opens interactive Shiny-based chat interface conversing Cassidy AI assistants. app automatically gathers project context supports conversation persistence.

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
code: cassidy_app(   assistant_id = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID"),   api_key = Sys.getenv("CASSIDY_API_KEY"),   new_chat = FALSE,   context_level = c("standard", "minimal", "comprehensive"),   include_data = TRUE,   include_files = NULL,   timeout = 300,   theme = NULL )

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
text: assistant_id Character. Cassidy assistant ID use. Defaults CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID environment variable. api_key Character. Cassidy API key. Defaults CASSIDY_API_KEY environment variable. new_chat Logical. TRUE, starts fresh conversation new context. FALSE (default), resumes recent conversation. context_level Character. Level context include starting new chat: "minimal", "standard", "comprehensive". Default "standard". Ignored new_chat = FALSE. include_data Logical. Whether include data frame context global environment starting new chat. Default TRUE. Ignored new_chat = FALSE. include_files Character vector file paths include initial context starting new chat. Ignored new_chat = FALSE. timeout Numeric. API timeout seconds. Default 300. theme bslib theme object. Default uses clean modern theme.

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
text: Launches Shiny app (called side effects).

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
text: app provides: Real-time chat Cassidy AI Automatic project context injection (new chats) Conversation history sidebar navigation Ability switch multiple conversations Mobile-responsive design

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
text: default (new_chat = FALSE), app resumes recent conversation. useful close app run code want continue discussing results. Use new_chat = TRUE want start fresh updated project context. recommended : made significant changes code starting new task topic want include different files context

title: Launch Cassidy Interactive Chat Application ‚Äî cassidy_app
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Resume most recent conversation (default)   cassidy_app()    # Start a new conversation with standard context   cassidy_app(new_chat = TRUE)    # Start new with comprehensive context   cassidy_app(new_chat = TRUE, context_level = "comprehensive")    # Start new with specific files   cassidy_app(     new_chat = TRUE,     include_files = c("R/my-analysis.R", "data/codebook.md")   ) } # }

title: Chat with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_chat
text: message Character. message send assistant. assistant_id Character. CassidyAI assistant ID. Defaults CASSIDY_ASSISTANT_ID environment variable. thread_id Character NULL. existing thread ID continue conversation. NULL (default), new thread created. context Optional context object cassidy_context_project(), cassidy_describe_df(), custom context object text element. Context sent thread creation efficiency. api_key Character. CassidyAI API key. Defaults CASSIDY_API_KEY environment variable. timeout Numeric. Request timeout seconds. Default 120.

title: Chat with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_chat
text: cassidy_chat S3 object containing: thread_id thread ID (save continue conversation) response assistant's response (cassidy_response object) message original message

title: Chat with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_chat
text: thread_id provided, new conversation thread created automatically. continue existing conversation, pass thread_id previous call.

title: Chat with CassidyAI ‚Äî cassidy_chat
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Simple one-off question   result <- cassidy_chat("What is the tidyverse?")   print(result)    # With project context   ctx <- cassidy_context_project()   result <- cassidy_chat("Help me understand this project", context = ctx)    # With data frame context   desc <- cassidy_describe_df(mtcars)   result <- cassidy_chat("What analyses would you recommend?", context = desc)    # Continue the conversation (context already set)   result2 <- cassidy_continue(result, "Tell me more") } # }

what: Add explanatory comments to an R script ‚Äî cassidy_comment_script
title: Add explanatory comments to an R script ‚Äî cassidy_comment_script

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script ‚Äî cassidy_comment_script

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script ‚Äî cassidy_comment_script
text: script_path Character. Path R script file. output_path Character NULL. save commented script. NULL, overwrites original (confirmation). "auto", creates new file "_commented" suffix. style Character. Comment style: "detailed" (line--line), "sections" (chunk-level), "minimal" (key operations ). thread_id Character NULL. Existing thread continue.

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script ‚Äî cassidy_comment_script
text: cassidy_chat object commented script.

title: Add explanatory comments to an R script ‚Äî cassidy_comment_script
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Add comments and save to new file   cassidy_comment_script("analysis/quick_efa.R", output_path = "auto")    # Section-level comments only   cassidy_comment_script("scripts/cleaning.R", style = "sections")    # Preview without saving   result <- cassidy_comment_script("my_script.R", output_path = NULL)   cat(chat_text(result)) } # }

title: Read File Contents as Context ‚Äî cassidy_describe_file
text: path Path file read. Can absolute relative working directory. max_lines Maximum number lines read. Use Inf read entire file. Defaults Inf (read ). lines Numeric vector specifying specific line numbers read. provided, lines included. Use NULL (default) read lines (subject max_lines). line_range Numeric vector length 2 specifying start end lines (e.g., c(10, 50) reads lines 10-50). Ignored lines provided. show_line_numbers Logical; TRUE, prepends line numbers line. Useful discussing specific line numbers. Defaults TRUE. level Character; detail level file content. One : "full": Complete file contents (default) "summary": Function signatures + key excerpts "index": Metadata function listing Used chat system manage context size. users use default.

title: Read File Contents as Context ‚Äî cassidy_describe_file

title: Read File Contents as Context ‚Äî cassidy_describe_file
text: function automatically detects file type extension applies appropriate syntax highlighting markdown output. can read files three ways: Entire file: Just provide path Specific lines: Use lines = c(1, 5, 10:20) Line range: Use line_range = c(10, 50) level parameter controls detail: "full": Best detailed code review, includes content "summary": Good understanding structure without full content "index": Minimal metadata, useful many files

title: Read File Contents as Context ‚Äî cassidy_describe_file

what: Understanding Thread IDs vs Conversation IDs
title: Retrieve conversation history from a thread ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread
text: Thread ID: Cassidy API identifier - use function Conversation ID: Local app identifier - use cassidy_export_conversation(), cassidy_delete_conversation() convert , use cassidy_get_thread_id().

title: Retrieve conversation history from a thread ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread

what: Get thread ID from conversation ID ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread_id
title: Get thread ID from conversation ID ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread_id
text: Retrieves Cassidy API thread_id associated saved conversation. bridge locally saved conversations Cassidy API functions.

title: Get thread ID from conversation ID ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread_id
code: cassidy_get_thread_id(conv_id)

title: Get thread ID from conversation ID ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread_id
text: conv_id Character. local conversation ID cassidy_list_conversations() (e.g., "conv_20260131_1234").

title: Get thread ID from conversation ID ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread_id
text: Character. Cassidy API thread_id, NULL conversation thread_id. Returns NULL warning conversation exist.

title: Get thread ID from conversation ID ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread_id
text: cassidyr package uses two different ID systems: Conversation IDs (local): Generated cassidyr app save conversations. Format: "conv_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS_RAND". Used : cassidy_export_conversation() cassidy_delete_conversation() cassidy_app() (resuming) Thread IDs (API): Generated Cassidy's servers create thread. Format: UUID-like string Cassidy. Used : cassidy_get_thread() cassidy_send_message() API functions function converts local conversation IDs API thread IDs.

title: Get thread ID from conversation ID ‚Äî cassidy_get_thread_id
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # List your saved conversations   convs <- cassidy_list_conversations()   print(convs)  # Shows both id and thread_id columns    # Get thread_id from conversation_id   conv_id <- convs$id[1]  # e.g., "conv_20260131_1234"   thread_id <- cassidy_get_thread_id(conv_id)    # Now use it with API functions   if (!is.null(thread_id)) {     thread <- cassidy_get_thread(thread_id)     print(thread)   }    # Or skip the conversion - thread_id is in the table!   thread_id <- convs$thread_id[1]   thread <- cassidy_get_thread(thread_id) } # }

title: List all saved conversations ‚Äî cassidy_list_conversations
text: package uses two types identifiers: Conversation ID (id): local app's identifier (e.g., "conv_20260131_1234"). Context sent first message efficiency. api_key Character. CassidyAI API key. Defaults CASSIDY_API_KEY environment variable.

what: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file ‚Äî use_cassidy_md
title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file ‚Äî use_cassidy_md
text: Creates project-specific configuration file provides automatic context start cassidy_app(). Follows similar conventions Claude Code's CLAUDE.md files, uses CASSIDY.md naming.

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file ‚Äî use_cassidy_md
code: use_cassidy_md(   path = ".",   location = c("root", "hidden", "local"),   template = c("default", "package", "analysis", "survey"),   open = interactive() )

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file ‚Äî use_cassidy_md
text: path Directory create file (default: current directory) location create file: "root" (CASSIDY.md), "hidden" (.cassidy/CASSIDY.md), "local" (CASSIDY.local.md .gitignore) template Template use: "default", "package", "analysis", "survey" open Whether open file editing (default: TRUE interactive sessions)

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file ‚Äî use_cassidy_md
text: Invisibly returns TRUE file created, FALSE cancelled

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file ‚Äî use_cassidy_md
text: can create project memory files several locations: CASSIDY.md - Project-level, checked git (location = "root") .cassidy/CASSIDY.md - Project-level hidden directory (location = "hidden") CASSIDY.local.md - Local-, auto-gitignored (location = "local") files automatically loaded start cassidy_app(). can also create modular rules .cassidy/rules/*.md files.

title: Create a CASSIDY.md configuration file ‚Äî use_cassidy_md
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create CASSIDY.md in project root use_cassidy_md()  # Create in .cassidy/ directory (keeps root clean) use_cassidy_md(location = "hidden")  # Create local-only file (not shared with team) use_cassidy_md(location = "local")  # Create a package development template use_cassidy_md(template = "package") } # }
